refnamediv.refpurpose: Implements low-pass and high-pass filters of different styles.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Implements the classical standard analog filter types: low-pass and high-pass. They are implemented with the four classical kinds of filters: Butterworth, Chebyshev Type I, Chebyshev Type II, and Elliptical. The number of poles may be any even number from 2 to 80.

refsect1.title: Syntax
refsect1.synopsis: ares clfilt asig, kfreq, itype, inpol [, ikind] [, ipbr] [, isba] [, iskip]

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: inpol -- The number of poles in the filter. It must be an even number from 2 to 80.
ikind (optional) -- 0 for Butterworth, 1 for Chebyshev Type I, 2 for Chebyshev Type II, 3 for Elliptical. Defaults to 0 (Butterworth)
ipbr (optional) -- The pass-band ripple in dB. Must be greater than 0. It is ignored by Butterworth and Chebyshev Type II. The default is 1 dB.
isba (optional) -- The stop-band attenuation in dB. Must be less than 0. It is ignored by Butterworth and Chebyshev Type I. The default is -60 dB.
iskip (optional) -- 0 initializes all filter internal states to 0. 1 skips initialization. The default is 0.

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: kfreq -- The corner frequency for low-pass or high-pass.
